title: 600ms+ connection problems
body:
Hey everyone. Just today I experienced a problem a couple of hours ago while playing League, just posting to see if anybody could offer me some assistance with it.

Everything was fine I connected really fast into champion select like normal, but in the loading screen and when the game started I had significant ping. It spiked to high as almost 900ms and didn't go any lower than 600ms and every time I try to test to see if it has changed in a custom game my client was still experiencing lag. No one else is on the internet, my phone Wifi off, LoL is the only thing running and I still lag so I'm certain it is league and not my internet provider. Youtube, Facebook, Twitch and everything else I tested all loading fast as usual but League is just sitting there at 600ms+ whenever I try to play a game. 

If it makes a difference I am using a Mac and my internet provider is Telstra but if the root of the problem is League itself I doubt those matter.
Can anyone help?

replies.body:
Hey there,

Definitely sounds like it may be an issue on your/your ISP's end.

Could you please do the following for me;

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the url to your ICSI netalyzr results.
Rung Telstra and they fixed something and it happens a lot less frequently now. Still weird how it happens but the other things didn't work. Thanks for helping though.

Hi there,

A suggestion I would like to make is try changing your wifi channel. ''If'' you do have access to your modem settings, I suggest you change your wifi channel to either 1,6,11. That way your wifi channel won't interfere with other wifi networks.  Never leave it on auto as if you do leave it on auto then the modem will just choose its own wifi channel which could interfere with other wifi networks if not set on the right channel. 

Hope this helps :)
